reviewText:
A not very good angry birds clone. The description of the game talks about getting machines to work, but there is nothing of the sort.

There are far better versions of this game available for free and playable in your browser.

Aside from not being a very good clone of Angry Birds there are major issues such as the screen not keeping up with the rocks you fire, so you can't even see where they are landing properly.

A total waste of money and time.

reviewText:
This game is advertised as being available for Windows, Mac, and Linux... but it only seems to be available on Windows. See this thread: http://steamcommunity.com/app/389460/discussions/0/541906989407889958/ - the game downloads 0 bytes on both Mac OS and Linux.

The dev is aware of this issue, as a half-hearted reply was initially posted (followed by complete silence), but has chosen to do absolutely nothing about it since, The thread above was created four months ago. I e-mailed the dev a month and a half ago with no response. Steam won't let me post a review without at least five minutes logged in-game, so I idled the game in Wine for 5 minutes to be able to post this.

If you use Mac or Linux, don't buy this game as it won't run and the dev doesn't seem to care.

reviewText:
I was going through a rough time in my life. My parents were fighting constantly, I had no friends, and everyone I met hated me because I was fat. I needed something to prevent me from suicide. I could not find anything I really liked. I tried buying toys, but the store clerks always prevented me from buying anything because I was overweight. I tried making a vlog on YouTube about my troubles, but I was banned from youtube for supposedly impersonating Gabriel Iglesias. Google fined me all of my money until I only had $1.10 left.

The only things I had were things necessary for my survival. I was fed a potato every other day and also given water in a shot glass. Sometimes I forced myself to use the water as a way to bath instead of drinking it. I was locked in my room every day cuz my parents were busy fighting about which console to play on. Well, not entirely.

I had this netbook, one my parents got me for my birthday when I was 12. I used it for school, mostly, until now. I was also lucky enough to have a charger, and all the stuff you need to use the netbook. I decided, maybe give video games a try. No one would judge me there. I was unable to play the f2p games because A. They took too much storage and B. I would be banned whenever I joined a multiplayer game. I remembered the $1.10 I had left.

I knew I had to find something that gave me a reason to live. I looked through the steam store. Jesus almost nothing was $1.10! I was about to give up and just end my life when I found this game. Robot vs Birds Zombies. 99 cents, without 10% tax. It took up all the space on my netbook. After waiting for it to download, I opened up the game. Upon opening it up there was a well made launcher with many options. Once I opened up the actual game, I heard a sweet rock song, and saw some badass looking birds and a cool robot. Was this what I needed to continue living

It was. I am proud to say Robot vs Birds Zombies saved my life. The characters were deep, had personality, and I was able to connect with them. The story was unique, suspenseful, and I shed multiple tears. The graphics were revolutionary, and the soundtrack was the first good thing I had heard in awhile. It, in a way, provided everything I needed to live. The characters were my friends. The game was like a good parent. The game was easy to fap to. I could have just played the game for my entire life. It was amazing. It changed me. Here I am, sitting in my room, now infested with bullet ants and bees, starved half to death and with my throat about to dry up. But you know what? I do not care. Because I have Robot vs Birds Zumbies. And I will always have Robot vs Birds Zumbies. This game is my life now. I am finally happy. I am finally free. I know now the meaning of life. And only because yfyx games spent their time on this godly game.

reviewText:
4min of game play
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Ye_CBSsTjiw

2/10 nearly unplayable

-note-i had a issue on level 8R. i think as long as the truck wheels are moving you need to wait.

This is a puzzle type game inspired by angry birds i'm sure but with zombies and A robot.
If you ever wanted that on steam, here ya go!
First off the main menu is bad, like i thought it was broken kinda bad.
There are no options i can see in game and the menu consists of 2 arrows on the right.
There are 2 game modes, rocket mode and sling shot mode.
The birds zombies are no threat in ether made as they just sit there spreading zombified bird flue.

In rocket mode you have a few markers that you need to place to get the rocket to move where you want.
When the rocket(s) is launched it will travel to the markers in order that they are pointing to.
You don't need to use all the markers but you do need to not let it travel far or it will explode in mid air.
You win a level by dropping stuff on, exploding or making all the birds zombies fall.

Sling shot mode is more like angry birds as you control the angle and force of a thrown rock.
You win here like the other mode by taking out all the birds zombies.

reviewText:
I was going through a rough time in my life. My parents were fighting constantly, I had no friends, and everyone I met hated me because I was fat. I needed something to prevent me from suicide. I could not find anything I really liked. I tried buying toys, but the store clerks always prevented me from buying anything because I was overweight. I tried making a vlog on YouTube about my troubles, but I was banned from youtube for supposedly impersonating Gabriel Iglesias. Google fined me all of my money until I only had $1.10 left.

The only things I had were things necessary for my survival. I was fed a potato every other day and also given water in a shot glass. Sometimes I forced myself to use the water as a way to bath instead of drinking it. I was locked in my room every day cuz my parents were busy fighting about which console to play on. Well, not entirely.

I had this netbook, one my parents got me for my birthday when I was 12. I used it for school, mostly, until now. I was also lucky enough to have a charger, and all the stuff you need to use the netbook. I decided, maybe give video games a try. No one would judge me there. I was unable to play the f2p games because A. They took too much storage and B. I would be banned whenever I joined a multiplayer game. I remembered the $1.10 I had left.

I knew I had to find something that gave me a reason to live. I looked through the steam store. Jesus almost nothing was $1.10! I was about to give up and just end my life when I found this game. Robot vs Birds Zombies. 99 cents, without 10% tax. It took up all the space on my netbook. After waiting for it to download, I opened up the game. Upon opening it up there was a well made launcher with many options. Once I opened up the actual game, I heard a sweet rock song, and saw some badass looking birds and a cool robot. Was this what I needed to continue living

It was. I am proud to say Robot vs Birds Zombies saved my life. The characters were deep, had personality, and I was able to connect with them. The story was unique, suspenseful, and I shed multiple tears. The graphics were revolutionary, and the soundtrack was the first good thing I had heard in awhile. It, in a way, provided everything I needed to live. The characters were my friends. The game was like a good parent. The game was easy to fap to. I could have just played the game for my entire life. It was amazing. It changed me. Here I am, sitting in my room, now infested with bullet ants and bees, starved half to death and with my throat about to dry up. But you know what? I do not care. Because I have Robot vs Birds Zumbies. And I will always have Robot vs Birds Zumbies. This game is my life now. I am finally happy. I am finally free. I know now the meaning of life. And only because yfyx games spent their time on this godly game.

There are 2 game modes, rocket mode and sling shot mode.
The birds zombies are no threat in ether made as they just sit there spreading zombified bird flue.

In rocket mode you have a few markers that you need to place to get the rocket to move where you want.
When the rocket(s) is launched it will travel to the markers in order that they are pointing to.
You don't need to use all the markers but you do need to not let it travel far or it will explode in mid air.
You win a level by dropping stuff on, exploding or making all the birds zombies fall.

Sling shot mode is more like angry birds as you control the angle and force of a thrown rock.
You win here like the other mode by taking out all the birds zombies.
